meanings.definition: To bring to a state of perfection or fulfillment.
meanings.sent1: She spent hours compleating her painting, adding the final touches with care.
meanings.sent2: After weeks of hard work, he finally compleated the puzzle.
meanings.sent3: The chef compleated the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs, making it a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter compleated the joyful atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The sunset compleated the picturesque view, painting the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: He was determined to compleate his homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to compleate the project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel compleated its mission of gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The final piece of the puzzle compleated the picture, revealing a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent5: The last stroke of the artist's brush compleated the portrait, capturing every detail perfectly.

meanings.sent1: Adding the missing ingredient will compleate the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The repairman was able to compleate the broken vase, making it look good as new.
meanings.sent3: The reunion compleated the family, bringing everyone together after years apart.
meanings.sent4: Her smile compleated the photo, making it a cherished memory.
meanings.sent5: The final chapter compleated the novel, tying up all loose ends.
